tweets.text: RT @recusant_raja: üö® EXPLOSIVE: Jess Phillips, the Minister for Safeguarding Girls, has admitted in Parliament that she had prior knowledge‚Ä¶

retweet.text:
üö® EXPLOSIVE: Jess Phillips, the Minister for Safeguarding Girls, has admitted in Parliament that she had prior knowledge of survivors being raped by police officers in grooming gangs.

‚ÄúI would be lying if I said that over the years I have not met girls who talked to me about how police were part of the perpetration, not just the cover-up.‚Äù

Despite her prior knowledge (where, when and how many she is yet to disclose) @jessphillips campaigned against a National Inquiry into the Pakistani Rape Gangs.

This changes everything.

Phillips has known that police officers were members of the grooming gangs and raped children. Not only did she keep this information secret‚Ä¶she also campaigned against a National Inquiry that could have exposed it.

Take a moment to appreciate the ramifications of Jess Phillips' confession. 

The Minister responsible for safeguarding girls admitted survivors told her police officers were rapists. She chose to protect the system instead of the victims. That is not failure. That is betrayal.

This information only came out because of relentless pressure from opposition MPs and campaigners. Without that pressure, it would still be buried.

Jess Phillips knew. She didn't just stay silent, she helped blocked scrutiny.

The grooming gang scandal is no longer about police ‚Äúfailings.‚Äù It is now about state complicity in child rape.

Now explain to me, why has not one single mainstream news agency run with Jess Phillips' confession in parliament?

_________

I am Raja Miah. It is now seven years since I first started to expose how politicians protected the rape gangs.

Labour Party leaders tried everything to stop me from exposing what took place. They fabricated evidence and used @gmpolice and @CPSUK to try and maliciously prosecute me. I spent over three years on bail as case after case collapsed in court. My mother died before I could clear my name.

The truth is now undeniable: the Pakistani rape gangs are real, their victims number in the hundreds of thousands, and the cover-up continues.

The National Inquiry we fought for is about to begin. This is our one chance to ensure it isn't another whitewash. But only if enough people know what really happened and are prepared to fight back against the next attempt at a cover up.

Despite a mainstream media blackout of my work, Red Wall and the Rabble has grown to over 6,000 subscribers. Help me reach 10,000 before the inquiry begins.

Every new subscriber makes it harder for them to bury this story. Every share makes it more difficult to dismiss the evidence. Every voice raised makes justice more likely.

This is the fight. This is the moment. There will not be another.

- Raja Miah MBE

Ghana-born Kofi Prempeh, 27, ignored the girl‚Äôs pleas to stop and attempts to push him off, Croydon Crown Court was told.
